lines.text: Dede's been dead for over 12 hours.
How do you know? What are you, a doctor?
No corpse stinks that much after only 12 hours. Take my word for it. Yes, I am a doctor.
What number are you calling from?
How should I know? I... I'm in a cafe, the Paris Midi.
How do you spell that?
How do you... with an "S" for shithead!
What kind of music do you like?
What? Oldies, I like oldies.
Oldies? Yeah, me too. You like this?
["I've Seen This Face Before" by Grace Jones is playing on the radio]
This? This is not old.
Well, three, four years.
I am cold, Walker...
Have you and your wife been to Paris before?
Yes, on our honeymoon.
Is it possible she met someone here? Someone she has been thinking about?
Since June 15th, 1968?
This is an emergency. Do you understand?
Yes sir, I do.
You understand but you don't give a damn? Is that it?

[Looking at Walker's ransacked hotel room]
I thought my place was messy!
Yeah, well, there's always someone who'll do you one better, huh?
You can talk about this in front of Michelle. She knows more about it than you do.
Who were the two guys in her apartment?
Probably our side.
Our side? Your side!

[Walker grabs Williams by the shoulder and fashions his hand like a gun]
You know what that means to me? He had his arm around her here, like this. He could have had a gun, like this. Pointed right at her. Shut up! Smile! Walk! Out the lobby! Huh, like this. Huh?
[Walker forces Williams towards the door]
Yes, yes, it could mean that, or they could have just been having a good time.
Mr. Shaap, you're talking about my wife... you must be thinking about yours.

[negotiating with the dealers the trade of the device in return for his wife]
My wife first!
You want your wife back or what? Then relax, be cool and just walk. We'll give them what they want. You will get your wife, I'll get my money and everyone will be happy... except Dédé.
Looking for your little friend? She was gone through there already.
Who gave you the instructions?
Dédé Martin.
Who else?
Nobody else, just Dédé. He is a friend of mine.
Uh uh. He was.
He was.
So, then you left the statue in the locker, right?
The suitcase.
The suitcase?
I was supposed to leave the statue but I saw him at the station and I panicked. I recognized him from the plane.
Bullshit! That's bullshit! The plane was packed. She didn't know where I was sitting.
Oh the stewardess spilled coffee on you. He has a bad temper.
Yes, he has. So, you saw him at the station, right?
By the lockers.
And you panicked? And...
I threw the suitcase in the locker.
With the statue?
No, just the suitcase.
You took the statue out.
No, it wasn't there.
Where was the statue, dear?
In another suitcase.

[starts pulling Michelle's hair]
What is this crap? What other suitcase? What other suitcase? Do you think we are idiots? Or what?
I don't think you're an idiot. Please.
This? This is what you want?
[throws the device on the river]
[last lines]
I love you, baby. I love you.
[first lines]
Do you know where you are?
No, it's changed too much.

[on Chris Montez - The More I See You]
I can't stand this music.
Where is she?
Please don't kill me.
Where is she?
What do you want?
My wife.
What wife?
Where is she?
Why did you kill Dédé? Why did you kill him?
I didn't. I didn't kill anyone.
What do you want from me?

[holding matches from the Blue Parrot]
Look familiar?
Where did you get that?
Your suitcase.
So you have it! Then pay me what you owe me. I did my job.
Job?
That's right. You know what I mean.
No, I don't know what you mean. All I know is I that I have your suitcase and you have my wife's. Do you understand?
[shouting]
You picked up the wrong suitcase at the airport!
You're looking for Dédé, man?
Yeah. You know him?
Sure, man. You don't look like you know him.
What am I supposed to look like?
Desperate, man.
Well, I'm desperate.
So where are you from, man? New York?
San Francisco.
Much better, man.
Yeah.
North Beach. Much, much better, man. Many places to dance.
[singing]
"If you go to San Francisco, be sure to wear a flower in your hair". Come on, man. Buy me a Kahlua and tell Jack your desperate troubles.
All I really need, man, is, uh, Dédé.
All the boys and girls are looking for Dédé these days. But Dédé's been gone, you know, two nights.
Yeah, but where?
Man, why not say what you're looking for? Dédé is not the only one who can show you.
Why don't you tell me what I'm looking for?
The white lady. Isn't that so?
Yes.
Heavy. Now I see the desperate man.
Is she all right?
Beautiful, man. Nobody has touched the lady. You don't worry, man. Follow me.
We missed you. Where were you, high up in the first class, I bet?
We got here yesterday.
Yesterday? And you haven't find the way out of the airport yet? I thought I was wrecked.
No, a mix-up with the bags.
Mix-up with the bags? Mmmm. To tell you the truth, I am a little wrecked. I hope I don't miss your speech. Is tomorrow, right?
No, no, Peter. Today. Today.
Today?
Yeah.
I hope you don't miss it.
Nice. Nice fruits.
Well, I would have prefered flowers.

[viewing Paris from their hotel room]
Nice view.

It's magnificent. It should look exceptionally lovely from the Eiffel Tower this afternoon where you and Dr. Alembert can share it together. I want to take a hot shower. But first, let me have the note so I can confirm your luncheon.
What for?
You can't speak French or use the phones.
I'm not gonna go! Don't confirm the luncheon.
Why not? You did tell Maurice Alembert that you were arriving a day early, didn't you?
Honey...
Oh Richard, you obviously want to see him. C'mon. Please give me the note. Richard...
I didn't tell when I was coming. Maurice Alembert, Maurice Alembert happens to be the chairman of the convention.
Richard, give me the note.
[Richard plays with her, hiding the note on his hands]
Give me the, give me...
[he eats the note]
Oh. Richard, don't swallow, you're gonna choke.
Now she says...
Well, at least let me get you some water to wash it down.
Maurice Alembert doesn't give a rat's ass about me. Not since he saw you at the Berkeley seminar last year. "Be sure to bring your lovely wife to Paris".
Was he the one with the long legs who took his shoes off when he spoke?

[smiling]
Never mind.
Once again, where is it?
I don't know!
Like hell you don't! Slut!

They don't teach you to talk to young girls. Keep it in English and cut the good cop, bad cop shit. There's no time. Come on, we're French. We understand each other, don't we? Trust us. We don't go around cutting throats. We're no bandits. We're just not that kind of people. We can protect you. Show us some good will and we'll show you good will, okay?
At the airport in San Francisco, a blond guy kissed on both cheeks? What did he say?
Bon voyage.
He gave you something.
She already told you. He gave her the Statue of Liberty. She put it in her suitcase. He gave you the Statue of Liberty. You put it in the suitcase. And then?
I got on the plane.
In Paris, what did you do?
I put it it my locker.
And the key, the key to the locker?
I left in the phone booth with chewing gun under the shelf.

[a pigeon flies outside scaring everyone]
Check the bathroom.
I woke up and you were gone.
Who is him?
He's... you know.
You guys make so much noise. Who are you? These guys are friends of yours?
Not really.
What the fucking are we talking about?
Take it easy, there is some mistake.
He's American, he may be crazy.
You goddamn right, there is some mistake.
Cool it. Cool it. Just cool it, mister. We're only asking the young lady a few questions.
You're not asking her jack shit, man. C'mon. Go on. Now get out of here, I don't have all day.
I'll go in my own time.

[pushes the guy away]
You'll go now. Don't mess with me, man. I'm an American and I am crazy!
Where is she?
Cool, man. No one has so much as stepped on her toe. She's here, man. And pure as the driven snow. C'mon, give it a try.
[shows a paper with cocaine]
Do a one-on-one and tell me if I lie. Come on, man. The nose knows.
[Walker tries it]
The white lady. Pure white. Good, not true? 600 Francs. You don't need Dédé, man.
The device doesn't belong to you, doctor Walker.
Doesn't belong to you either.

[punches the table]
It belongs to me! I brought it over!
